content:
Hiya, on Ubuntu 21.10 I just checked out rust-lang/rust:master, ran git clean -fdx, python3 ./x.py setup (option b), then python3 ./x.py test, and it failed. Is that expected?

Documenting error index (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
Building stage0 tool error_index_generator (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
   Compiling same-file v1.0.6
   Compiling walkdir v2.3.1
   Compiling error_index_generator v0.0.0 (/home/bgeron/src/ext/rust/src/tools/error_index_generator)
    Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 3.99s
/home/bgeron/src/ext/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-tools-bin/error_index_generator: error while loading shared libraries: libLLVM-13-rust-1.59.0-nightly.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory


command did not execute successfully: "/home/bgeron/src/ext/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-tools-bin/error_index_generator" "html" "/home/bgeron/src/ext/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/doc/error-index.html" "1.59.0"
expected success, got: exit status: 127


Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:47:10

This is on commit 16d8a91d5. I'll try again on branch stable.
Yeah, I think this is a known bug. Generally running all tests isn't something most people need to do locally, in this case you can likely fix by passing --stage 2 or so.
:thumbs_up: Thanks!
Bram Geron has marked this topic as resolved.
I'm on Ubuntu 21.10 and don't have that failure
